title: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi unveils logo of ITFoK 2026
content: Festival to be held from January 25 to February 1; nine international productions to echo “Voices in the Silence”

title: Justice Manoj Kumar Gupta appointed Chief Justice of Uttarakhand HC
content: Justice Manoj Kumar Gupta will assume charge after the incumbent, Justice Guhanathan Narendar, demits office on Jan. 9 upon attaining the age of 62

title: R. Usha takes over as SPMVV Registrar
content: She joined the varsity as a lecturer in 2001, became an associate professor in 2006, and has been serving as a professor since 2013

title: Heavy rush at Sabarimala ahead of Makaravilakku
content: On Thursday, the queue of pilgrims waiting to climb the ‘18 holy steps’ stretches up to Sabaripeedam, prompting the police to temporarily halt the movement of pilgrims at Pampa

title: CBI arrests telecom official over alleged illegal sale of SIM cards for cybercrime
content: The official, serving as area sales manager, was allegedly involved in facilitating the fraudulent issuance of bulk SIM cards in violation of Department of Telecom rules

title: Jagan warns of launching stir for Rayalaseema Lift Irrigation scheme
content: Accusing Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu of placing personal interests above State’s welfare, the YSRCP chief vows to complete the project at ‘lightning speed’ on coming to power

title: Kaveri 2.0 autofilling property details from e-khatas, builders claim ECs having incomplete details
content: Builders claim the name of the project, carpet area, tower number, block number are not being reflected properly in Encumbrance Certificates

title: RSP faces internal backlash over Eravipuram Assembly seat
content: While a section of the party has proposed fielding Karthik Premachandran, son of Kollam MP N.K. Premachandran, the move has ignited sharp resistance from members who decry the rise of ‘dynasty politics’.

title: Protest mounts against Poovaranthode hydel project over blasting damage
content: Extensive rock blasting for the project has caused serious structural damage to nearby houses, rendering several of them uninhabitable, say protesters

title: Congress rejigs strategy in Palakkad district, pushes for Thankappan, Balram
content: The Congress is reportedly unhappy with the proposal to cede the Pattambi seat to the Indian Union Muslim League

title: Idukki became an epicentre of protests after Gadgil report
content: Protests erupted after  Gadgil committee recommended that 37% of the Western Ghats be declared eco-sensitive. Of the 123 villages identified as ESAs, 48 were located in Idukki district. Residents were apprehensive that these recommendations would lead to forced evictions and conversion of farmland into protected forest

title: Senior citizen loses ₹26.52 lakh to online fraudsters; FIR registered
content: The victim received a message from an unknown mobile number, asking him to do an RTO challan update; it contained APK link, which the complainant believed it to be genuine and downloaded the file

title: Tamil Nadu unveils India’s first deep tech start-up policy at UmagineTN 2026
content: The policy aims to position the State as the country’s premier deep tech hub by fostering advanced innovation, driving industrial growth, and empowering Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, while building a robust ecosystem for deep and emerging technologies to accelerate Tamil Nadu’s journey towards a $1 trillion economy

title: Assam BJP counters allegation of electoral rolls manipulation
content: The party says a confused and ‘directionless’ Opposition, unable to place even a single credible political issue before the people, is now suffering from deep frustration

title: Gauri Lankesh murder case accused contesting Jalna civic polls as independent candidate
content: Shrikant Pangarkar is in the fray from ward 13. His opponents are candidates from the BJP and several other parties, though the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena has not fielded a contestant

title: 'Energy greed': Venezuela acting prez calls out Trump; leaves door open for Russia, China
content: Venezuela's interim President Delcy Rodriguez has accused the US of using false claims about drugs and human rights as a pretext to seize the nation's oil. She stated Venezuela is open to mutually beneficial energy partnerships with clearly defined commercial contracts. This comes as the US announced it would manage future Venezuelan crude sales and oversee its global petroleum trade.

title: 'Axis of war': Russia warns EU over peacekeeping force in Ukraine; takes shot at US
content: Russia has branded Ukraine and its allies an "axis of war," calling the proposed peacekeeping force deployments plan "dangerous" and "destructive". Moscow warned that any such troops would be considered legitimate military targets. This strong reaction follows new security guarantees announced for Kyiv. Meanwhile, the US seized a Russian-flagged tanker, which Moscow claims will escalate tensions.

title: Tilak Varma fitness update: 'He is set to resume training in 7-10 days' - confirms cricketer’s coach
content: India batter Tilak Varma is expected to resume training within seven to ten days after undergoing minor surgery, his childhood coach has confirmed. The 23-year-old is unlikely to miss the T20 World Cup and could return for the New Zealand T20I series. Tilak remains India’s designated No. 3 in the shortest format.

title: 'We're not leaving Netflix': Warner Bros Discovery's message to shareholders — read letter
content: Warner Bros. Discovery's board has rejected Paramount's latest $108 billion takeover bid, citing insufficient value and certainty. The board highlighted significant costs for WBD if the Paramount deal fails and expressed doubts about Paramount's ability to secure the massive debt financing required for the leveraged buyout. WBD reaffirmed its commitment to a superior merger with Netflix.

title: 'Economic blockade': Kerala CM targets Centre; calls for satyagraha on Jan 12
content: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has accused the Centre of a "financial stranglehold" and announced a satyagraha protest on January 12 against an alleged "economic blockade." He also criticised Congress, saying that "the party, which claims to be the principal opposition party of the country, is also moving along the same path" as the central govt.

title: Ruturaj creates history: Cricketer breaks multiple records; surpasses Kohli and Babar
content: Ruturaj Gaikwad smashed a brilliant 134 in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, reaching his 20th List A century in a record 95 innings. He also became the fastest to 5,000 List A runs. Despite stellar domestic form and a recent ODI century, Gaikwad's omission from the upcoming India squad raises eyebrows. He will lead CSK in IPL 2026.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy ideas, from EVs and solar to massive battery production. He highlighted China's dominance in these sectors, contrasting it with US potential. Musk emphasized batteries, like Tesla's Megapacks, as crucial for doubling US energy throughput without new power plants, especially for AI's growing demands.

title: 'Donroe' doctrine: 5 reasons why Trump's Maduro shock was not about oil. It was a msg for Xi
content: The US seizure of Nicolas Maduro and control over Venezuela's oil marks a significant blow to China's influence in Latin America. This move, rerouting billions in crude to the US, undermines Beijing's decade-long economic diplomacy and its strategy of championing sovereignty. It signals that economic ties don't guarantee protection against US military power.

title: Delhi’s private schools can’t shake off fee committees: HC extends deadlines, autonomy under challenge
content: Fee regulation committees will move forward in Delhi’s private schools—for now. The High Court declined to stay the government notification but extended deadlines for setting up committees and submitting proposed fee structures. The petitioners argue the 2025 law is unconstitutional and creates overlapping controls with the 1973 Act. Schools call it intrusive as the dispute now heads to further hearings—and may travel beyond the High Court.

title: Philanthropy push: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife donates billions to non-profits; biggest giveaway in 2025
content: Mackenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon's founder, has significantly reduced her stake in the e-commerce giant, selling shares worth $13 billion.  She continues her massive philanthropic efforts, donating $7.1 billion to non-profits in 2025 alone, including over $1.2 billion to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  These substantial, unrestricted grants are seen as a counterpoint to tech companies scaling back DEI initiatives.

title: Hindu man lynched in Bangladesh: Main accused held; 21 arrested so far
content: Police arrested Yasin Arafat, the main suspect in the murder of Hindu worker Dipu Chandra Das. Arafat, a former madrasa teacher, allegedly led a mob that attacked and killed Das. This incident follows a period of unrest in Bangladesh. Twenty-one people have been arrested in connection with the case. Nine have given confessional statements.

title: From Op Sindoor to Venezuela: How Chinese weapons, radars keep failing — Explained
content: China's arms exports faced a significant setback as its weapons, including air defence systems like the HQ-9 and JY-27A radar, proved ineffective during India's Operation Sindoor and a recent Venezuelan operation. These incidents highlighted a technological gap, with Russian-supplied missiles also failing to perform. The failures have damaged China's reputation as a reliable arms supplier.

title: Drama at PSL! Ex-franchise owner withdraws: 'South Punjab is where my heart is'
content: Former Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen has withdrawn from the PSL auction for two new franchises being held in Islamabad. Announcing his decision on X, Tareen said his PSL journey was about representing South Punjab, not business. He plans to watch as a fan this year but hinted at a return if Multan is sold again. Nine bidders remain in the race.

title: AI, IT and yes, booze too: Gujarat’s big GIFT City push
content: Gujarat is launching a major push into AI and the digital economy with a dedicated IT-AI cluster near GIFT City and the establishment of the Indian AI Research Organisation (IAIRO). These initiatives aim to attract global tech giants, foster innovation, and position the state as a national and global hub for emerging technologies.

title: Exclusive: Why no Hikaru? Inside new FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship
content: FIDE and Freestyle Chess ended a long-running dispute over world championship authority by agreeing to stage the first official FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship. The conflict began in late 2024 over title rights, sparking public clashes and player concerns. A renewed dialogue in 2025 led to reconciliation, aligning Freestyle’s tour with FIDE governance and creating a unified championship framework.

title: Explained: Will Venezuelan crude lead to cheap petrol for American consumers?
content: The timing matters. Oil prices are already under pressure globally, and petrol prices have eased after years of inflation-driven pain. The Venezuela pitch is being sold as a way to lock that relief in.

title: Did Sidda celebrate record of longest-serving CM prematurely?
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's supporters celebrated a 'country chicken feast' for his tenure, though the official record as longest-serving CM is days away. Political analysts questioned the premature fanfare amidst speculation about leadership changes.  Siddaramaiah, however, highlighted his government's achievements and dismissed opposition criticism.

title: US consulate issues fresh warning to B1/B2 visa holders — what is it?
content: The US Consulate General in Mumbai has issued a warning to B1/B2 visitor visa holders regarding unauthorized employment. Engaging in work activities not permitted by the visa can lead to deportation and a potential lifetime ban from entering the United States. Travelers are advised to understand visa regulations before planning their trips.

title: ‘Bramayugam’: Mammootty film enters Oscar Academy space
content: Mammootty's film 'Bramayugam' is set for a prestigious screening at the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures in Los Angeles on February 12, 2026. This marks the first time a Mammootty-starrer will be shown at the museum, as part of the 'Where the Forest Meets the Sea' folk horror series.

title: VHT: Sarfaraz scripts history; smokes 30 off Abhishek to record fastest-ever fifty
content: Sarfaraz Khan smashed the fastest fifty in Vijay Hazare Trophy history. His explosive 62 off 20 balls was a highlight. Mumbai narrowly lost to Punjab by one run. Punjab finished top of Group C. Both teams qualified for the quarter-finals.

title: 'CM's aides removed evidence': ED's big charge against Mamata; I-PAC raids trigger row
content: The Enforcement Directorate accused West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee of obstructing a money-laundering probe into a coal smuggling syndicate. The ED claims Banerjee, accompanied by police, entered a residence and I-PAC office, seizing documents and electronic devices. Banerjee rejected the allegations, calling the searches politically motivated and an attempt to seize TMC's election strategy.

title: How ICE shot a mother in cold blood - and Trump defended it
content: Family members and neighbours told local reporters that she was not participating in protests or attempting to interfere with law enforcement on the day of the shooting. She was described as someone who had recently been navigating significant personal change, including the loss of her former spouse, while focusing on caring for her children and settling into daily life in the city.

title: More degrees, fewer jobs: Why India’s educated women are still shut out of the workforce
content: India’s rising female enrolment in higher education masks a deeper economic failure. Despite earning degrees in record numbers, only about one-third of Indian women are considered employable, according to TeamLease data. Sectoral barriers, persistent pay gaps, and weak career pipelines continue to push women out of the workforce, turning educational gains into stalled economic progress.

title: 'Slow down? That’s not fast bowling': The belief that shaped Mitchell Starc
content: Mitchell Starc’s Ashes heroics capped a series that underlined both his durability and evolution. As the left-armer moves closer to the game’s all-time highest wicket-takers, his childhood coach Neil de Costa recalls the defining philosophy that shaped Starc’s career: bowl fast, swing hard and ignore anyone who tells you otherwise.

title: JEE Main 2026 exam dates revised: Check complete schedule here
content: The National Testing Agency has revised the JEE Main 2026 Session 1 schedule, with exams now set from January 21 to January 29 instead of January 30. The exam city slip has been released on the official website. Admit cards are expected in the second week of January, while Paper 1 and Paper 2 exams will be held in multiple shifts.

title: Big surprise in Maharashtra civic polls: 12 suspended Congress corporators join BJP
content: Twelve Congress corporators and a former Block President, suspended for aligning with the BJP in Ambernath Municipal Council, have officially joined the Bharatiya Janata Party. State BJP President Ravindra Chavan welcomed them, citing their commitment to city development as the reason for induction. This move follows a controversial local alliance that aimed to foster civic governance and development in Ambernath.

title: New labour codes: What they mean for employees? Salary & benefits rules explained
content: New Labour Codes explained: The draft rules released by the government are important because they outline several key provisions on how employees' wages, salary, allowances and gratuity benefits are structured.

title: The quiet unease beneath an AI-led hiring boom: Why 80% of people feel unprepared for work in 2026
content: A new LinkedIn report reveals a 2026 job market marked by uncertainty, with 80% of job seekers feeling unprepared and recruiters struggling to find quality talent.  AI is reshaping hiring, making it more data-driven but less transparent.  This creates a confidence gap, as both sides navigate evolving, algorithm-driven processes where visibility depends on machine-readable signals.

title: Hit by Op Sindoor, panic-stricken Pak mounted frantic lobbying in US
content: Following India's military retaliation against a terror attack, Pakistan urgently sought US mediation to halt New Delhi's strikes.  FARA filings reveal Islamabad's frantic lobbying efforts, involving over 60 contacts with US officials and media.  Pakistan's hired firm, Squire Patton Boggs, aimed to secure American intervention to "somehow halt" India's operations, indicating significant behind-the-scenes panic.

title: JEE Main 2026 city intimation slip for Session 1 released at NTA website: Direct link to download here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the JEE Main 2026 Session 1 city intimation slip for lakhs of students. This slip informs candidates of their exam city, aiding in advance travel and accommodation planning. It is crucial to note that this is not the admit card, which will be issued separately.

title: Glenn Hall dies at 94: Remembering Mr Goalie, NHL ironman legend
content: Glenn Hall, one of the toughest goaltenders the NHL has ever seen, passed away at the age of 94. Known as “Mr. Goalie,” he set an unmatched ironman record by starting 502 straight games and changed how the position was played. A Hall of Famer and Stanley Cup champion, his impact on the game will be remembered for generations.

title: 'Shameful, embarrassing': After clip shared by student, civic body erases defaced murals on Gwalior wall
content: A viral video of defaced yoga murals in Gwalior, shared by a Class 11 student, sparked outrage. The artwork, part of a Smart City initiative, was marred by vulgar markings. Following public outcry and an influencer's repair attempt, the Municipal Corporation repainted the wall white and plans a Gen Z art event to promote positive messages.

title: ‘Can’t read a man’s mind too’: Actor Ramya reacts to SC remark on stray dogs
content: Actor Divya Spandana's social media post comparing unpredictable animals to men sparked debate after a Supreme Court observation on street dogs and public safety. The court emphasized the dangers posed by stray animals on roads, urging civic bodies to strictly implement rules for their management and removal.

title: SBI projects 7.5% GDP growth! FY26 figures may surpass govt estimates
content: India's economic expansion in FY26 might surpass official forecasts, with a revised GDP base year potentially pushing growth closer to 7.5%. While agriculture growth is set to moderate, the services sector is expected to be the primary driver, projecting a robust 9.1% expansion. Industrial output will see a slight uptick, though mining output is anticipated to decline.

title: Fugitive wife killer living as Punjabi carpenter caught by police 26 years later
content: A carpenter in Ludhiana, living under an assumed identity for 14 years, was apprehended by Delhi Police. He was a fugitive, having escaped parole in 2000 after being sentenced for his wife's murder in 1992.  The police tracked him down through a tip-off, ending his decade-long evasion.

title: Missing since December, woman’s skeletal remains found 300 metres from her house in UP
content: A skeleton, believed to be that of a 30-year-old missing woman, was discovered in a mustard field near her home in Nagram. Family members identified a sari found at the scene, leading to suspicions about her husband, who is now under investigation. The remains have been sent for post-mortem to confirm identity and cause of death.

title: Delhi pollution is deadlier than you think: Ask your heart
content: A pilot study in Delhi revealed a direct link between rising air pollution and cardiovascular emergencies, with admissions increasing significantly with spikes in AQI, PM10, and PM2.5. In contrast, Shimla showed no such correlation, highlighting the severe short-term health impacts of pollution in urban areas.

title: Ashes: 'I am sorry' - Harry Brook's apology puts spotlight on England's off-field conduct
content: England's white-ball captain Harry Brook has publicly apologised for a nightclub altercation in New Zealand, admitting his behaviour was wrong and caused embarrassment. The incident, which occurred before the Ashes tour, resulted in a fine and a final warning. This apology surfaces as the ECB begins a thorough review of the team's disappointing Ashes campaign, with off-field conduct under scrutiny.

title: Delhi: 3 days after motorist fell off Wazirpur flyover, another critically injured
content: Two men have fallen from the Wazirpur flyover in Delhi within three days, with one fatality and another critically injured. Police suspect an engineering defect due to a one-foot gap between carriageways and inadequate barriers. They are writing to the concerned agency to examine structural flaws and have recommended speed breakers and barriers.

title: UP govt cancels assistant professor recruitment exam after paper leak
content: The Uttar Pradesh government has cancelled the assistant professor recruitment exam. This decision follows serious irregularities and a paper leak. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered the cancellation after an inquiry confirmed the issues. The exam was held last year for over a thousand posts. The government assures a fair and transparent process for the new exam dates.

title: Human-elephant conflict spikes in Jharkhand, 22 people dead in 21 days
content: Jharkhand faces a severe human-elephant conflict, with 22 deaths in 21 days. A rogue elephant in West Singhbhum, in musth, has killed 16 since January 1, while another in Ramgarh turned violent after being attacked. Operations are hampered by IEDs. Villagers in vulnerable areas are being relocated.

title: Confidential data leaked? Japan nuclear regulator loses phone in China
content: Japan's nuclear safety regulator reported a work-issued smartphone containing sensitive contact details of nuclear security personnel was lost by an employee during a personal trip to China. The device, used for disaster communication, did not access facility data but held confidential information, raising security concerns.

title: Erumely buzzes with festive spirit as foreign visitors join pilgrims
content: Primary attraction for foreign visitors seems to be the celebration of religious harmony, where two temples and a mosque stand close by, and pilgrims honouring all of them in their rituals

title: Air taxi, designed and manufactured in Guntur, clears key structural tests
content: It has been developed specifically for Indian conditions, with priority to safety, durability and reliability, says Magnumwings official

title: Several illegal clinics sealed in Ballari district
content: Several individuals found practising medicine without valid medical qualifications at different places in the district

title: Man gets 20 years RI for marrying a child and sexually assaulting her
content: Parents of both the bridegroom and the then minor bride have also been convicted of aiding the child marriage which is illegal

title: Cabinet Sub-Committee reviews plans for NTR statue, memorial park in Amaravati
content: The bronze statue weighing 3,500 tonnes is poised to become one of the most prominent landmarks in the capital city

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Toll rises to eight in sugar factory boiler accident in Belagavi
content: Police book three officers, say investigation is on and that they will book more of those responsible for the accident, if necessary

title: AgriNext Startup workshop held
content: The workshop was aimed at identifying the challenges faced by farmers, and enabling existing startups to develop technology-driven solutions to address these issues

title: Aralam declared as Kerala’s first butterfly sanctuary
content: Butterfly surveys conducted over the past 25 years have documented extraordinary diversity in the sanctuary

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu wants SHG women to become entrepreneurs
content: Stating that the future belongs to women, the Chief Minister stresses the need for branding traditional handicrafts and local food products

title: Amendments to Forest Conservation Act guidelines don't open doors for privatisation of forest management: Officials
content: The clarification comes a day after Congress alleged that the amendments in guidelines of the Van (Sanrakshan Evam Samvardhan) Adhiniyam, 1980, (earlier Forest Conservation Act) have opened the door for the privatisation of forest management

title: Mizoram cricketer dies after collapsing during a match
content: The State’s cricket association said K. Lalremruata, who represented Mizoram in Ranji and Syed Mushtaq Ali trophies, suffered a stroke while playing

title: Parakamani case: A.P. High Court orders speedy probe into death of TTD former AVSO
content: The High Court asks TTD Executive Officer to submit a plan on modernising the counting and assessing the value of offerings made to Lord Venkateswara

title: Fertilizer prices, subsidies determined by Central government, says official
content: It is providing a subsidy of approximately ₹1.92 lakh crore to support farmers nationwide, says Agriculture Director Manazir Jeelani

title: State Police Chief seeks inquiry into alleged bail bid in Pathanamthitta POCSO case
content: According to a complaint submitted to the CM, Pathanamthitta Cyber Cell Circle Inspector B.K. Sunil Krishna attempted to facilitate bail for the accused in the case

title: Ashtamudi Wetland Management Unit constituted
content: Kerala High Court had  expressed its displeasure at the delay  in forming the unit.  The unit has been constituted with the District Collector as chairperson

title: Book on life of President Droupadi Murmu released in Visakhapatnam
content: A sanitation worker releases the book, authored by former MP Yarlagadda Lakshmi Prasad, under a tree on Andhra University campus

title: Jawahirullah urges government to correct addresses of fishers in official records
content: His statement comes after The Hindu on Wednesday (January 7) reported that many residents of fishing hamlets in the city were finding it difficult to update records in Aadhaar and other documents, such as nativity certificates, due to lack of proper addresses

title: Government medical college doctors to go on indefinite strike
content: All teaching activities will be boycotted from January 13, and all non-emergency medical services in medical college hospitals will be discontinued from the week after

title: Indian national stranded on Yemen's island evacuated to Saudi Arabia
content: The development comes as heavy fighting between rival armed factions in Yemen has intensified in recent days

title: Permit only 300 shops on Marina beach, orders Madras High Court
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and A.D. Jagadish Chandira also order that the shops should be allotted through drawal of lots under the supervision of a retired High Court judge

title: Karur stampede: CBI summons police personnel who were deployed for security at TVK chief Vijay’s rally
content: The CBI, which re-registered the case based on directions from the Supreme Court on October 13, had collected the bandobast plan containing the list of police personnel who were deployed for duty for the TVK rally

title: Backlash after school exam question in Chhattisgarh about dog’s name has ‘Ram’ as option
content: The incident triggered protests from right-wing outfits in front of the District Education Officer with Vishva Hindu Parishad seeking the arrest and dismissal of those who prepared the question for the exam

title: UIDAI launches mascot Udai to simplify communication on public understanding of Aadhaar
content: The mascot has been selected from various entries received through a national design and name competition on the MyGov platform

title: Threat mails to blow up four courts in A.P. turn out to be a hoax
content: Unidentified persons sent mails claiming that bombs were planted in the courts in Eluru, Madanapalli, Ananthapur and Chittoor

title: Delhi riots case: Court issues release orders for fifth accused granted bail
content: The court noted that the accused, Shahdab Ahmed, had fulfilled all bail conditions imposed by the Supreme Court

title: Bomb hoax: police intensify surveillance at Kozhikode Medical College Hospital
content: An email was received at the official ID of medical college Principal claiming that bombs have been placed at the MCH. Inspections find the threat to be hoax

title: Lawyers’ body begins fast against move to shift Gauhati High Court
content: While 154 lawyers of the Gauhati High Court Bar Association voted for the shifting, 1,164 voted against the government decision

title: Life imprisonment for seven RSS-BJP workers for murdering CPI(M) leader at Thalassery in 2008
content: Latheesh, secretary of the CPI(M) Thiruvangad local committee, was hacked to death on the Chakyathmukku beach, near Thalassery. The court found accused numbers one to seven guilty and sentenced them to 35 years of imprisonment on four counts

title: Gadgil: conservationist who saw humans as constituents of the ecosystem
content: Madhav Gadgil would go on to shift the paradigm in the global conservation discourse, giving primacy to human rights over exclusive wildlife protection

title: Himachal High Court receives bomb threat email; security beefed up
content: Upon receiving the information, the bomb squad, dog squad and police reached the court. However, they did not discover any explosives within the court complex, an official said

title: Congress leaders criticise delay in censor board clearance for Vijay’s Jana Nayagan
content: Referring to her experience as a former member of the censor board, Karur MP Jothimani said the CBFC has become outdated in the present technological era and that it is increasingly being used as a political tool.

title: Mamata Banerjee took away key evidence during raids in coal ‘scam’ case against I-PAC official: ED
content: ED said the actions of Mamata Banerjee and the Kolkata Police commissioner resulted in “obstructions” in the ongoing investigation and proceedings being undertaken as per the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA)

title: AI start-ups ‘co-architects’ of India’s future, says PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi said that AI start-ups were the “co-architects” of India’s future and said that the country has immense capacity for both innovation and large-scale implementation

title: Former MLA P.V. Anvar appears before ED for interrogation in connection with suspected fraudulent loan transactions
content: Investigation pertains to loans amounting to ₹7.5 crore to Malamkulam Constructions and ₹4.61 crore to Pee Vee Aar Developers, sanctioned by the Kerala Financial Corporation against the same collateral properties within a short span

title: Supreme Court defers hearing on pleas challenging ECI’s SIR of electoral rolls to January 13
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice Surya Kant, which had fixed the pleas for hearing during the day, said it will resume the proceedings on Tuesday (January 13)

title: Congress leader alleges I-PAC acts as 'eyes, ears' of TMC, questions ED raid
content: I-PAC acts as the eyes and ears of the TMC. They are engaged in framing all sorts of strategies to ensure the win of the TMC, and for that, they can do anything else in exchange for money, alleges Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on plea of Justice Varma assailing validity of inquiry panel by Lok Sabha
content: Senior advocates for Justice Varma questioned the procedure for setting up the parliamentary panel and said only the Speaker of Lok Sabha and chairman of Rajya Sabha are entitled to admit the motion for removal of a judge from office

title: Grading the Trae Young trade: How did the Hawks and Wizards fare?
content: Trae Young is headed from the Hawks to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. Which team fared best? We graded the trade.

title: Sources: Hawks end Young era, send G to Wiz
content: The Hawks are trading four-time All-Star Trae Young to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert, sources said.

title: Chiefs 'aware' of abuse allegations by Rice's ex
content: The Chiefs acknowledged Wednesday that they are aware of domestic violence allegations made by a woman who is the ex-girlfriend of Rashee Rice, with the team saying it's in communication with the league and will have no additional comment at this time.

title: Jim Harbaugh hails John, hopes he's NFC-bound
content: Jim Harbaugh doesn't expect his older brother John to be out of a job very long but just hopes his next landing spot isn't in the AFC, where the Chargers reside. "As I told him, whatever team he goes to is going to be formidable," Jim said.

title: Spurs' Sochan: 'Polite exchange' with Vanderbilt
content: Spurs forward Jeremy Sochan downplayed the severity of a postgame incident Wednesday that involved Lakers forward Jarred Vanderbilt poking him in the face.

title: Lipsey touted as best PG in nation after ISU win
content: Iowa State coach T.J. Otzelberger declared Tamin Lipsey the nation's best point guard after he led the Cyclones past Baylor and to the first 15-0 start in program history Wednesday night.

title: Scheffler to make '26 debut at American Express
content: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler will make his 2026 debut at the American Express Championship later this month, tournament officials said Wednesday night. Scheffler also has committed to the WM Phoenix Open.

title: Sources: Rockies, Lorenzen agree to $8M contract
content: Right-hander Michael Lorenzen and the Rockies are in agreement on a one-year, $8 million contract that includes a club option, sources told ESPN.

title: HOF goalie Hall, who started 502 in a row, dies
content: Glenn Hall, a Hockey Hall of Famer whose streak of 502 consecutive starts as a goaltender remains an NHL record, has died. He was 94.

title: 🏈 Our latest NFL mock draft predicts Picks 1-32
content: Which QB fits with the Raiders at No. 1? How high could Jeremiyah Love go? Will the Buckeyes run the first round? Let's project the first 32 picks for April.

title: Barnwell predicts the NFL playoff bracket: Could two lower seeds go to the Super Bowl?
content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

title: 'What if we are the people who win these games?' A new feeling at Ole Miss
content: After a chaotic month, Ole Miss won the kind of game it always loses, leaving its fans wondering how far it can go.

title: Six NBA trade proposals: How the Lakers, Bucks, Warriors and others could make major moves
content: Let's help Milwaukee build around Giannis, the Lakers and the Timberwolves fill major needs, and Golden State end its long saga.

title: Live trade tracker: Details for every deal of the 2025-26 season
content: Here's every trade of this regular season, starting with the Hawks dealing away franchise star Trae Young.

content: What makes up the Bills O-line unit's success and its diverse personalities off the field? Let them explain.

content: Vic Fangio introduced the Meatball Award this season for his defense to serve as that extra bit of motivation.

content: New York Jets GM Darren Mougey will be heavily evaluating quarterbacks in the college playoffs ahead of the draft.

title: Power Rankings: Unbeaten Vanderbilt, Nebraska crack top 10
content: The Commodores and Cornhuskers have outperformed preseason expectations, headlining this week's biggest risers.

content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

content: The Kings fired Mike Brown this time last season, but one year later don't seem any closer to finding their way.

content: This week, Amber Glenn looks to defend her back-to-back national titles -- and become the oldest U.S. Olympic women's singles skater in 98 years.

title: Flex and superflex rankings for 2026
content: An early look at the top 200 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs for 2026 drafts, updated throughout the fantasy football offseason.

title: How Trevor Lawrence's grill gift was kept a surprise -- and came together
content: The quarterback's grill came from a collaboration of his mom, wife, former Clemson teammate and the Jaguars social media team.

title: Newest layer in the Packers-Bears rivalry? Cheese grater hats
content: DJ Moore's celebration helped turn a foam cheese grater hat into the latest Bears-Packers rivalry fixture.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Karl to commit to Bayern after Real Madrid comments
content: Bayern Munich's teenage star Lennart Karl recently courted interest from Real Madrid but is ready to commit his long-term future to the club. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: How Illegal Coal Mining Case Put I-PAC Under Probe Agency Radar, Led To Raids
content: High drama unfolded on Thursday as the Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted raids in West Bengal and Delhi, including at the I-PAC office and the residence of its director Pratik Jain in Kolkata.

title: Global Cooperation Is Changing, Not Declining: World Economic Forum
content: The Global Cooperation Barometer 2026 shows that countries and companies are working together in new ways, with more regional, smaller and flexible partnerships.

title: Trump Wants Venezuela's Oil. What It Means For Climate
content: Analysts say that technology and stricter emission controls may help, but the economic and climate feasibility of exploiting Venezuelan oil may remain a thorn in the flesh.

title: Adani's Mundra Port Becomes Indias 1st To Berth Fully Laden Crude Carrier
content: In a defining moment for India's maritime and energy infrastructure, Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd on Thursday announced the berthing of India's first-ever fully laden Very Large Crude Carrier at its Mundra Port.

title: "Documents Stolen": I-PAC Head's Family's Big Charge Against Probe Agency ED
content: The family of Pratik Jain, chief of political consultancy firm I-PAC, has filed a complaint with the police against the Enforcement Directorate, alleging theft of important documents during searches at their home that took place today.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Indore, Gandhinagar, Bengaluru: Why Your 'Clean' City Doesn't Have Clean Water
content: The recent loss of lives in Indore, the outbreak of typhoid in Gandhinagar, and water contamination-linked illness cases in Bengaluru expose a deep systemic failure - one that forces us to question what 'clean' and 'well-managed' truly mean in India.

title: Video: BJP Leader, 73, Touches Feet Of Jyotiraditya Scindia's 31-Year-Old Son
content: A video showing BJP MLA Devendra Kumar Jain, 73, touching the feet of 31-year-old Mahaaryaman Scindia, the son of Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, has gone viral on social media, triggering political and social discussion.

title: Opinion: Blog | Madhav Gadgil: The 'Durable Optimist' Who Believed Science, Too, Has Obligations
content: Gadgil, despite decades of frustration and bureaucratic sidelining, believed that people could organise, that knowledge could travel, and that democracy, however delayed, could still correct its course.

title: Main Accused In Bangladeshi Hindu Man Dipu Das' Lynching Arrested
content: Bangladesh police have arrested the prime suspect in the brutal lynching of Dipu Chandra Das, a minority Hindu garment worker killed over allegations of blasphemy.

title: Rogan Josh To Paneer Tikka: Delhi Government's Menu For Official Events
content: From chicken tandoori and mutton rogan josh to paneer tikka, dal makhani and gulab jamun, the Delhi government has drawn up an extensive menu for its official events in the national capital.

title: Forcing Woman To Continue Pregnancy Violates Bodily Integrity: Delhi Court
content: Forcing a woman to continue with her pregnancy violates her bodily integrity and aggravates mental trauma, the Delhi High Court has said while discharging an estranged wife in a criminal case filed by her husband.

title: Two Indian Truck Drivers Caught In US With Cocaine 'Enough To Kill 1,13,000 People'
content: Two Indian truck drivers were arrested in Indiana for transporting 309 pounds of cocaine worth $7 million. Gurpreet Singh, 25, and Jasveer Singh, 30, had entered the United States in 2017 and 2023, respectively.

title: US Forces Seize Venezuela-Linked Ship In 'Call Of Duty' Style Night Raid
content: US Special Forces on Wednesday carried out a high-risk takeover of a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the North Atlantic in a mission that mirrored the visuals of the iconic video game Call of Duty.

title: "Mamata Banerjee Obstructed Probe": Probe Agency Approaches High Court
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has walked out with a laptop, phone and multiple documents from the house of Prateek Jain, the chief of election consultant IPAC, during a raid by the Enforcement Directorate, the central agency has alleged.

title: Why Oil Still Shapes US Geopolitics In An Era of Record Production
content: The United States has made oil the centrepiece of its global strategy. According to the Energy Institute Statistical Review of World Energy, the US produced approximately 20 million barrels per day in 2024.

title: Venezuela Crisis May Lead To Cheaper Crude Oil: Niti Aayog Member To NDTV
content: Dr Arvind Virmani, renowned economist and a member of the NITI Aayog, said he believes if the oil fields of Venezuela are revived within six months, more oil will reach the market, and crude oil prices will drop.

title: Infant Had Breathing Issues Mid-Air, Air India Express Makes Priority Landing
content: An Air India Express Bengaluru-bound flight from Jaipur made a priority landing after a one-year-old child developed breathing issues mid-flight.

title: '30 Nation-Building Awards, Now Shown As Criminal': Sonam Wangchuk To Court
content: Activist Sonam Wangchuk, who has always spoken against violence and received 30 awards for nation-building, is now being portrayed as a criminal, the Supreme Court was told today.

title: Pakistan's Ex-Minister Accuses Islamabad Of Weaponising Courts To Silence Dissent
content: A former Pakistani minister has accused Islamabad of weaponising courts to silence dissent against the state.

content: A senior BJP leader from Uttar Pradesh was heard saying that he does not need Muslim votes, and that he will not engage with the community in their "joys and sorrows".

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
